mutants.original_line: """Convert an input number, represented as a string, of a specified base (integer) into its binary equivalent as a string.
mutants.code:
def number_to_binary(x: str, base: int) -> str:
    """"""
    x = int(x, base)
    return bin(x)[2:]

def number_to_binary(x: str, base: int) -> str:
    """Convert an input number, represented as a string, of a specified base (integer) into its binary equivalent as a string.
    The base can be either 8 (indicating octal), 10 (indicating decimal), or 16 (for hexadecimal).
    """
    x = int(x, base)
    return bin(x)[3:]

def number_to_binary(x: str, base: int) -> str:
    """Convert an input number, represented as a string, of a specified base (integer) into its binary equivalent as a string.
    The base can be either 8 (indicating octal), 10 (indicating decimal), or 16 (for hexadecimal).
    """
    x = int(x, base)
    return bin(x)[1:]

def number_to_binary(x: str, base: int) -> str:
    """Convert an input number, represented as a string, of a specified base (integer) into its binary equivalent as a string.
    The base can be either 8 (indicating octal), 10 (indicating decimal), or 16 (for hexadecimal).
    """
    x = int(x, base)
    return bin(x)[0:]

def number_to_binary(x: str, base: int) -> str:
    """Convert an input number, represented as a string, of a specified base (integer) into its binary equivalent as a string.
    The base can be either 8 (indicating octal), 10 (indicating decimal), or 16 (for hexadecimal).
    """
    x = int(x, base)
    return bin(x)[1:]

def number_to_binary(x: str, base: int) -> str:
    """Convert an input number, represented as a string, of a specified base (integer) into its binary equivalent as a string.
    The base can be either 8 (indicating octal), 10 (indicating decimal), or 16 (for hexadecimal).
    """
    x = int(x, base)
    return bin(x)[-2:]
